http://money.cnn.com/2007/06/13/news/international/china_yuan.reut/index.htm?postversion=2007061310
 
 Honestly, what are they going to come up with next?
 
 "Paris Hilton to receive the Congressional Medal of Honor"
 
 "George W. Bush nominated for Nobel Peace Prize"
 
 "Eating a supersized Big Mac menu lowers risk of cardiovascular disease"
 
 "Deficits are good".......................oh wait................

post_info.post_title: [Eh?!!] US Treasury: China not manipulating the yuan [/Eh?!!]

LOL. What did you want them to do? Come out and say "China is manipulating the Yuan but we are terrified of the consequences if those jokers on the hill try to do something about it"?
 
 While I do not like Paulson in general, he does seem to have a grasp of our economic situation. I think they are running out of options as far as keeping congress under control, though. He managed to kill the 27% tarriff last year, but the American people seem to be catching on to the fact that despite the rosy picture painted by tame economists, there is something VERY wrong with our economy and they expect their congressmen to do something about it. Currently blame seems to be split pretty evenly between illegal immigrants and the chinese.

Well I didn't expect them to be competely honest about it, but a little sense of reality would have been nice even if it was just to save face.
 I mean, the Chinese and others are also looking at this report and can only come to the conclusion that the US government comprises of people who have the intellectual capacity of a toddler.
 
 The US Treasury should have just said that the Chinese are manipulating the Yuan, but that retaliatory tariffs are utterly counterproductive and that even a child can see that (but apparently not toddlers :p).

I'm ambivalent about this report, the problem is most the people in the US government are XXXXXX and would probably be incapable of understanding subtbtlies like "China bad, but if we impose big tariff we make it worse".
 
 The only thing they understand is "China bad, lets change their government! Oh wait, they have nukes, lets just screw them over by taxing people trying to buy their stuff."
